com.pump.swing

Class SwingSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.swing.SwingSearch

  • public class SwingSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    Some static methods relating to searching a JTextComponent or JTable.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public static boolean find(javax.swing.text.JTextComponent textComponent,
                           java.lang.String searchPhrase,
                           boolean forward,
                           boolean matchCase)
        This performs a basic search, starting from the current selection. Also this consults UIManager.get("beepWhenSearchFails") to determine whether to beep or not if a match is not found.
        Parameters:
        textComponent - the component to search.
        searchPhrase - the phrase to search for.
        forward - whether to move forward or backward (aka "next" or "previous").
        matchCase - whether to match the case or not.
        Returns:
        true if a match is found, false otherwise.

      • find

        public static boolean find(javax.swing.JTable table,
                           java.lang.String searchPhrase,
                           boolean forward,
                           boolean matchCase)
        This performs a basic search, starting from the current selection. Also this consults UIManager.get("beepWhenSearchFails") to determine whether to beep or not if a match is not found.
        Parameters:
        table - the component to search.
        searchPhrase - the phrase to search for.
        forward - whether to move forward or backward (aka "next" or "previous").
        matchCase - whether to match the case or not.
        Returns:
        true if a match is found, false otherwise.

      • countOccurrence

        public static int countOccurrence(javax.swing.text.JTextComponent textComponent,
                                  java.lang.String searchPhrase,
                                  boolean matchCase)
        Returns the number of occurances of a phrase in a text component.
        Parameters:
        textComponent - the text component to search.
        searchPhrase - the phrase we're looking for.
        matchCase - whether we have to be case sensitive or not.
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of the phrase in the text component.

      • find

        public static boolean find(javax.swing.text.JTextComponent textComponent,
                           java.lang.String searchPhrase,
                           boolean forward,
                           boolean matchCase,
                           int startingIndex,
                           int[] selection)
        This performs a basic search, starting from a specific index. If a match is found, the indices are stored in the selection array, and true is returned.
        Parameters:
        textComponent - the component to search.
        searchPhrase - the phrase to search for.
        forward - whether to move forward or backward
        matchCase - whether to match the case or not.
        startingIndex - the index in the document to begin searching.
        selection - the array to store the indices in if a match is found.
        Returns:
        true if the array provided now contains two indices enclosing the search phrase.

      • highlight

        public static void highlight(javax.swing.text.JTextComponent tc,
                             int selectionStart,
                             int selectionEnd)
        This can create a highlight effect for a selection of text. Originally this was designed to work with the AbstractSearchHighlight class, but it can work with any object that has a constructor accepting the same arguments this method uses.

        By default this will use the AquaSearchHighlight, but you can call UIManager.put("textSearchHighlightEffect", myClassName) to change this default class.

        Parameters:
        tc - the text component.
        selectionStart - the beginning of the selection to highlight.
        selectionEnd - the end of the selection to highlight.

      • highlight

        public static void highlight(javax.swing.JTable table,
                             int selectedRow,
                             int selectedColumn)
        This can create a highlight effect for a selection of text. Originally this was designed to work with the AbstractSearchHighlight class, but it can work with any object that has a constructor accepting the same arguments this method uses.

        By default this will use the AquaSearchHighlight, but you can call UIManager.put("textSearchHighlightEffect", myClassName) to change this default class.

        Parameters:
        table - the table to highlight.
        selectedRow - the row that is selected.
        selectedColumn - the column that is selected.

      • clearHighlights

        public static void clearHighlights(javax.swing.text.JTextComponent jtc)
